property.name: hadoop.kms.http.port
property.description: The HTTP port for KMS REST API.

property.name: hadoop.kms.http.host
property.description: The bind host for KMS REST API.

property.name: hadoop.kms.ssl.enabled
property.description: Whether SSL is enabled. Default is false, i.e. disabled.

property.name: hadoop.http.max.threads
property.description: The maxmimum number of threads.

property.name: hadoop.http.max.request.header.size
property.description: The maxmimum HTTP request header size.

property.name: hadoop.http.max.response.header.size
property.description: The maxmimum HTTP response header size.

property.name: hadoop.http.temp.dir
property.description: KMS temp directory.

property.name: hadoop.kms.key.provider.uri
property.description: URI of the backing KeyProvider for the KMS.

property.name: hadoop.security.keystore.java-keystore-provider.password-file
property.description: If using the JavaKeyStoreProvider, the file name for the keystore password.

property.name: hadoop.kms.cache.enable
property.description: Whether the KMS will act as a cache for the backing KeyProvider. When the cache is enabled, operations like getKeyVersion, getMetadata, and getCurrentKey will sometimes return cached data without consulting the backing KeyProvider. Cached values are flushed when keys are deleted or modified.

property.name: hadoop.kms.cache.timeout.ms
property.description: Expiry time for the KMS key version and key metadata cache, in milliseconds. This affects getKeyVersion and getMetadata.

property.name: hadoop.kms.current.key.cache.timeout.ms
property.description: Expiry time for the KMS current key cache, in milliseconds. This affects getCurrentKey operations.

property.name: hadoop.kms.audit.aggregation.window.ms
property.description: Duplicate audit log events within the aggregation window (specified in ms) are quashed to reduce log traffic. A single message for aggregated events is printed at the end of the window, along with a count of the number of aggregated events.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.type
property.description: Authentication type for the KMS. Can be either 'simple' (default) or 'kerberos'.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.kerberos.keytab
property.description: Path to the keytab with credentials for the configured Kerberos principal.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.kerberos.principal
property.description: The Kerberos principal to use for the HTTP endpoint. The principal must start with 'HTTP/' as per the Kerberos HTTP SPNEGO specification.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.kerberos.name.rules
property.description: Rules used to resolve Kerberos principal names.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.signer.secret.provider
property.description: Indicates how the secret to sign the authentication cookies will be stored. Options are 'random' (default), 'string' and 'zookeeper'. If using a setup with multiple KMS instances, 'zookeeper' should be used.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.signer.secret.provider.zookeeper.path
property.description: The Zookeeper ZNode path where the KMS instances will store and retrieve the secret from.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.signer.secret.provider.zookeeper.connection.string
property.description: The Zookeeper connection string, a list of hostnames and port comma separated.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.signer.secret.provider.zookeeper.auth.type
property.description: The Zookeeper authentication type, 'none' (default) or 'sasl' (Kerberos).

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.signer.secret.provider.zookeeper.kerberos.keytab
property.description: The absolute path for the Kerberos keytab with the credentials to connect to Zookeeper.

property.name: hadoop.kms.authentication.signer.secret.provider.zookeeper.kerberos.principal
property.description: The Kerberos service principal used to connect to Zookeeper.

property.name: hadoop.kms.audit.logger
property.description: The audit logger for KMS. It is a comma-separated list of KMSAuditLogger class names. Default is the text-format SimpleKMSAuditLogger only. If this is not configured, default will be used.
